result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

RE:  Felony possess firearm as repeater, on 04-23-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felon possessing a firearm.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-16-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no possession of any firearms.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Defendant refused to sign bail bond.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
